availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel S. Galloway (Graves County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Graves County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Son of John Galloway and Lucy Thompson Galloway. Married to Charity Adline Gillian Galloway. Father of John C. Galloway, Nancy J. Galloway, William T. Galloway, Nickolas L. Galloway, Thomas L. Galloway, Lucy Galloway, and Albert Galloway. Farmer in Graves County in 1850. Farmer in Graves County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, District 2, p. 419A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, p. 5.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, Mayfield, p. 171B.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 28413.
J.H. Battle, W.H. Perrin, and G.C. Kniffin, Kentucky, a History of the State, (Louisville and Chicago: F.A. Battey, 1885), p. 255.
"Samuel S. Galloway (1823-1889)," Find A Grave, Memorial 76493738, accessed October 4, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/76493738.
